LanguageData.Chicken.label: chicken
LanguageData.Chicken.description: The most traditional farm bird, the chicken is raised for its eggs and meat. It grows very quickly and lays eggs very often.
LanguageData.Chicken.tools.claws.label: claws
LanguageData.Chicken.tools.beak.label: beak
LanguageData.Chicken.tools.head.label: head
LanguageData.Duck.label: duck
LanguageData.Duck.description: A very common type of farm bird, also appearing in the wild, the duck is raised for its delicious meat. It grows quick but lays eggs quite rarely.
LanguageData.Duck.tools.claws.label: claws
LanguageData.Duck.tools.beak.label: beak
LanguageData.Duck.tools.head.label: head
LanguageData.Goose.label: goose
LanguageData.Goose.description: A domesticated bird kept by humans as poultry for it's eggs and meat. Lays eggs very often, however they take a long time to hatch.
LanguageData.Goose.tools.claws.label: claws
LanguageData.Goose.tools.beak.label: beak
LanguageData.Goose.tools.head.label: head
LanguageData.Turkey.label: turkey
LanguageData.Turkey.description: A short, fat, flightless bird known for its hilarious 'gobbling' call. It has been long domesticated, but also lives in the wild.
LanguageData.Turkey.tools.claws.label: claws
LanguageData.Turkey.tools.beak.label: beak
LanguageData.Turkey.tools.head.label: head
